result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell B Johnson

State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce recorded statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

2:28 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mitchell B Johnson in court.  Attorney Terese J. Singer in court for Mitchell B Johnson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim is present in the hearing room and speaks on bond. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
